availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Albert C. Breith (Campbell County, Kentucky, clerk and captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, clerk and captain (U.S.A.). Native of Bavaria. Son of Peter Breith and Elizabeth Breith. Clerk in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 53rd Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant and captain from October 4 1864, to September 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 632.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 527.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0455.
